audit_metadata.audit_scope: Transaction cost realism validation - execution costs, commissions, spreads, slippage, fees
audit_metadata.verdict: MIXED - Some costs realistic, CRITICAL issues found

top_3_findings: CRITICAL: TradeTracker hardcoded costs don't match ExecutionModel ($2.60 commission vs $0.65 per contract)
CRITICAL: TradeTracker hardcoded spread ($0.03) doesn't vary with moneyness, DTE, or volatility
CRITICAL: Delta hedging costs not implemented anywhere - significant cost drag missing

estimated_cost_underestimation.commission_mismatch: Underestimated by 2x (using $2.60 total instead of $0.65/contract * 2 legs = $1.30 PLUS fees)

retail_commissions.tastyworks: $0.00 open, $10.00 close per leg (max $10 per order)

reality_check.total_realistic_cost_per_contract: $0.65 commission + $0.055 OCC + ~$0.05 exchange = $0.755 per contract per side

trade_tracker.verdict: INCONSISTENT - doesn't match ExecutionModel, unclear if fees included

issues_found: TradeTracker uses $2.60 flat per trade, ExecutionModel uses $0.65/contract + fees
For 2-leg straddle: ExecutionModel = 2 * ($0.65 + $0.055 + ~$0.05) = ~$1.51 ENTRY + ~$1.51 EXIT = $3.02 total
TradeTracker is HIGHER but may still be underestimating if using retail $0.00 open / $10 close model
Lack of consistency means one of them is WRONG

impact_on_returns.direction: MIXED - TradeTracker higher than ExecutionModel but still may underestimate retail costs

1_commission_structure.recommendation: UNIFY commission model across all code. Use ExecutionModel.get_commission_cost() everywhere. Validate against actual broker fee schedule (Tastyworks $10 close is common).

2_bid_ask_spreads.status: PARTIALLY REALISTIC BUT HARDCODED IN BACKTEST

adjustments: VIX: continuous scaling from 1.0x at VIX=15 to 2.0x at VIX=35+
execution_model.verdict: REASONABLE MODEL - captures moneyness, DTE, and vol effects

trade_tracker.adjustments: NONE - does not vary with market conditions
trade_tracker.implementation: Uses ask/bid from Polygon data PLUS hardcoded $0.03 spread
trade_tracker.verdict: WRONG - hardcoded spread ignores actual market spreads AND duplicates Polygon bid/ask

issues_found: TradeTracker hardcodes $0.03 spread on TOP of Polygon bid/ask prices
This DOUBLE-COUNTS spread: Polygon already has bid/ask embedded
TradeTracker spread doesn't widen during high vol (March 2020 would be same as calm periods)
ExecutionModel has sophisticated spread model but ISN'T USED in backtests
Backtests use TradeTracker, so they get wrong spreads

impact_on_returns.march_2020_backtest: Returns massively inflated - spread should be $1-2 per leg, not $0.03
impact_on_returns.annual_impact: -3% to -8% depending on vol regime frequency

2_bid_ask_spreads.recommendation: CRITICAL FIX: TradeTracker must use ExecutionModel.get_spread() based on actual market conditions (VIX, moneyness, DTE). Remove hardcoded $0.03. Polygon prices ALREADY include bid/ask - don't add spread on top.

3_slippage_modeling.status: SOPHISTICATED MODEL EXISTS BUT NOT USED IN BACKTESTS

limit_orders.adverse_selection: Filled when market moving against you

trade_tracker.entry_implementation: Uses Polygon ask (long) or bid (short) - spread already included
trade_tracker.exit_implementation: Uses mid price MINUS hardcoded spread - NO size-based slippage

issues_found: ExecutionModel has slippage model, TradeTracker doesn't use it
Entry: TradeTracker uses ask/bid so spread is captured, but no additional slippage
Exit: TradeTracker uses mid ± hardcoded spread, no size-based adjustments
Large orders (if ever tested) would show unrealistic fills

impact_on_returns.current_position_sizes: Minimal - 1-2 contract trades have low slippage

3_slippage_modeling.recommendation: Add size-based slippage to TradeTracker exit logic. Use ExecutionModel.get_execution_price() with quantity parameter.

strategies_requiring_hedging: Profile 1: Long ATM Straddle (high gamma, needs frequent hedging)
Profile 3: Short ATM Straddle (DEFINITELY needs delta hedging)
Profile 4: Long ATM Call (may hedge delta)

hedging_frequency_assumptions.gamma_scalping_strategy: Rebalance at ±10-20 delta = 5-20 times per position

execution_model.implementation: ES commission ($2.50) + half-spread ($6.25) + market impact (10-25% for large orders)

trade_tracker.implementation: NONE - delta hedging costs not modeled at all

issues_found: Profiles with high gamma (1, 3, 6) require delta hedging in reality
No hedging costs modeled = P&L massively overstated
Profile 3 (short straddle) is UNDELTAHEDGED in backtest = taking directional risk
Real implementation would need delta hedging = significant cost drag

profile_1_ldg.impact: Could turn profitable trades into losers

profile_3_charm.estimated_rebalances: 15-25 per trade (more frequent due to gamma risk)
profile_3_charm.impact: LIKELY ELIMINATES ALL EDGE - short premium strategies live on collecting theta, die by hedging costs

impact_on_returns.verdict: STRATEGY VIABILITY UNKNOWN until hedging costs added

4_delta_hedging_costs.recommendation: IMMEDIATE ACTION REQUIRED: Implement delta hedging simulation. Model rebalancing triggers (±10 delta threshold), calculate ES futures costs per rebalance, add to P&L. This is NON-NEGOTIABLE for profiles 1, 3, and 6.

5_other_transaction_costs.verdict: Regulatory fees mostly covered. Missing small exchange fees (~$0.03/contract).

entry_timing.code: Uses entry_date close price as spot
entry_timing.reality: Can trade any time during regular hours (9:30-4:00 ET)
entry_timing.realism: Acceptable - conservative (can't use intraday opportunistic timing)

exit_timing.reality: Can exit any time during day
exit_timing.assumption: Exit on close of day N

settlement_prices.concern: Options settle at different times than stock
settlement_prices.code: Not relevant - not holding to expiration

after_hours_gaps.impact: Minor - overnight risk exists but not a cost modeling issue

scaling_analysis.1000_contracts: Significant impact, need to model as % of open interest

code_implementation.market_impact_scaling: NOT modeled (ExecutionModel has placeholder for >10 contracts)
code_implementation.verdict: Not an issue at current scale, but becomes critical if capital increases

7_liquidity_constraints.recommendation: Add position size validation: warn if size exceeds 1% of typical open interest. Add market impact function for large orders.

bid_ask_spreads.realistic: NO - TradeTracker hardcoded, doesn't widen in high vol
bid_ask_spreads.fix_required: Use ExecutionModel spread calculation based on VIX/moneyness/DTE

slippage.realistic: ExecutionModel good, TradeTracker doesn't use it

regulatory_fees.realistic: YES - OCC, FINRA, SEC fees included in ExecutionModel

annual_return_impact.total_estimated_degradation: -15% to -50% depending on strategy and period

critical_fixes_required_before_deploymen.action: Add rebalancing logic to TradeTracker: trigger at ±10 delta, use ExecutionModel.get_delta_hedge_cost()
critical_fixes_required_before_deploymen.impact: Will likely eliminate edge on gamma-heavy strategies (Profiles 1, 3, 6)
critical_fixes_required_before_deploymen.effort: High - needs rebalancing logic, ES futures simulation

critical_fixes_required_before_deploymen.action: Remove hardcoded $0.03 spread, use ExecutionModel.get_spread() with actual VIX/moneyness/DTE
critical_fixes_required_before_deploymen.impact: Will reduce returns by 3-8% annually, more during high vol
critical_fixes_required_before_deploymen.effort: Medium - refactor TradeTracker to use ExecutionModel

critical_fixes_required_before_deploymen.action: TradeTracker should use ExecutionModel.get_commission_cost() instead of hardcoded $2.60
critical_fixes_required_before_deploymen.impact: Minor - may increase or decrease costs slightly

critical_fixes_required_before_deploymen.action: Use ExecutionModel.get_execution_price() with quantity parameter in TradeTracker
critical_fixes_required_before_deploymen.impact: Minor at current 1-2 contract size, critical if scaling

validation_required.task: Compare ExecutionModel costs vs actual broker statements
validation_required.validate: Commission + fees per contract matches reality

validation_required.task: Validate spread assumptions against real SPY options data
validation_required.source: Polygon bid/ask data from March 2020, normal 2024 periods
validation_required.validate: Spreads during VIX 80+ are 5-10x normal, not constant

validation_required.method: Simulate gamma of actual positions, count ±10 delta threshold crossings

before_next_backtest_run: Fix spread modeling (use ExecutionModel, pass VIX/moneyness/DTE)
Implement delta hedging for gamma-heavy profiles
Add position size warnings if >1% of open interest

verdict.confidence_in_results: LOW - missing critical cost component (delta hedging)

Profile_1_LDG.verdict: Returns SEVERELY overstated, likely unprofitable after hedging

Profile_3_CHARM.verdict: LIKELY UNPROFITABLE after hedging - short premium edge destroyed by hedging costs

Profile_4_VANNA.verdict: Depends on hedging strategy - may be viable unhedged

Profile_5_SKEW.missing_costs: Spread should be 1.5-2x wider for OTM

verdict.overall_conclusion: Current backtest results are UNRELIABLE for deployment decisions. Delta hedging costs alone could eliminate 50-100% of reported edge on gamma-heavy strategies. Must implement realistic hedging simulation and dynamic spread modeling before trusting results.
next_steps: 2. Fix spread modeling to use ExecutionModel
3. Re-run all backtests (train/validation/test) with realistic costs
5. If strategies still profitable after fixes → proceed to validation
6. If strategies become unprofitable → abandon or redesign
